result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Romeo R Thompson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Romeo R Thompson not in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia appeared by video for Romeo R Thompson.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Case set for calendar call.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court takes no action as to bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Romeo R Thompson not in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Romeo R Thompson.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Case set for plea and sentencing.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.
Calendar call scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Romeo R Thompson in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. Status conference held. Parties have reached a resolution and are requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court.  
Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Matter set for plea and sentencing.  Defendant was here but became ill.  Atty. Cerniglia requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Romeo R Thompson in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Atty. Cerniglia requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Romeo R Thompson in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Romeo R Thompson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Romeo R Thompson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
